items.summary: Add seven specific exercises to the exercise library with complete details: Squats (Legs, 3 sets x 12 reps, description: 'Foundation for the entire body'), Push-ups (Chest/Shoulders/Triceps, 3 sets x max reps, description: 'Essential for every gym session'), Bench Press (Chest, 3 sets x 10 reps, description: 'Best exercise for broad chest'), Deadlift (Back/Overall Strength, 3 sets x 8 reps, description: 'Gives power to the entire body, focus on form'), Pull-ups/Lat Pulldown (Back/Biceps, 3 sets x 8-10 reps, description: 'Essential for V-shape body'), Overhead Press (Shoulders, 3 sets x 10 reps, description: 'For broader shoulders'), Plank (Core/Abs, 3 sets x 1 minute, description: 'Perform at the end of workout')

Create a comprehensive diet plan template with six meals (Breakfast, Mid-Morning, Lunch, Pre-Workout, Post-Workout, Dinner) where each meal has two food options: Breakfast Option 1: '3 Boiled Eggs + Brown Bread / Roti', Option 2: 'Oats with Milk + 1 Banana'; Mid-Morning Option 1: '1 bowl Roasted Chana (High Protein)', Option 2: 'Handful of Peanuts + 1 Apple'; Lunch Option 1: 'Dal + Rice + Curd (Dahi) + Salad', Option 2: 'Soya Chunks Curry + 2 Roti + Salad'; Pre-Workout Option 1: '1 Banana + Black Coffee (for energy)', Option 2: '1 Sweet Potato (Shakarkandi)'; Post-Workout Option 1: '4 Egg Whites or Paneer (50g)', Option 2: 'Sattu Drink (3-4 spoons in water/milk)'; Dinner Option 1: 'Paneer Bhurji / Chicken + 2 Roti', Option 2: 'Moong Dal Khichdi + Omelette'

Display the seven exercises (Squats, Push-ups, Bench Press, Deadlift, Pull-ups/Lat Pulldown, Overhead Press, Plank) with their sets, reps, and descriptions in the exercise library browser interface, organized by their target muscle groups

Display the comprehensive diet plan in the client dashboard diet plan view showing all six meal times (Breakfast, Mid-Morning, Lunch, Pre-Workout, Post-Workout, Dinner) with both food options clearly labeled as Option 1 and Option 2 for each meal
